fr.sorbonne_u.cps.mapreduce.utils

Class IntInterval

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.cps.mapreduce.utils.IntInterval
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class IntInterval
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    The class LongInterval represent a closed interval of long values.

    Description

    Implementation Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Invariants

     invariant       last() > first()

    Created on : 2024-06-24

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IntInterval clone()
      clone this integer interval object.
      int first()
      return the first value in the interval.
      boolean in(int value)
      return true if value is in the (closed) interval and false otherwise.
      int last()
      return the last value in the interval.
      void merge(IntInterval following)
      merge two contiguous intervals into one, represented by this interval.
      IntInterval split()
      split this interval in two equal parts, updating this interval to be the first and returning the following intervaL (the second part); this interval must contain at least four values otherwise the result will be null as the split cannot occur.
      boolean splitable()
      return true if the interval contains enough values to be split in two sub-intervals.
      java.lang.String toString()

      • splitable

        public boolean splitable()
        return true if the interval contains enough values to be split in two sub-intervals.

 post    true        // no postcondition.

      • split

        public IntInterval split()
        split this interval in two equal parts, updating this interval to be the first and returning the following intervaL (the second part); this interval must contain at least four values otherwise the result will be null as the split cannot occur.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        the new interval representing the second part of this interval before the split.

      • merge

        public void merge(IntInterval following)
        merge two contiguous intervals into one, represented by this interval.

        Contract

         pre     last() + 1 == following.first()
 post    first() == first_pre && last() == following_last_pre
        Parameters:
        following - interval that follows immediately this interval.
